intro: Prostanthera lithospermoides, commonly known as the coastal prostanthera, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white to pale blue flowers and narrow, aromatic leaves. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Prostanthera lithospermoides is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
